name: Gem Dog
resistance: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons not made of adamantine

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc: The gem dog’s spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The gem dog can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, verbal, or somatic components: * At will: color spray, dancing lights, faerie fire * 3/day each: blur, heat metal, hypnotic pattern, mirror image, misty step, moonbeam * 1/day: hallucinatory terrain

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The gem dog has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gem dog attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws, or it can make two Gem Spine Spray attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gem Spine Spray
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (5d10 + 3) piercing.

actions.name: Blinding Gleam
actions.desc: If the gem dog is in bright light, it can force one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it to make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw if the gem dog isn’t incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 minute as the gem dog reflects light into its eyes. A creature that isn’t surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can’t see the gem dog until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the gem dog in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
